snippet: A federal judge made the right decision to grant class-action status to a lawsuit brought by public housing residents and their visitors.
abstract: Editorial praises Federal Judge Shira Scheindlin for her series of rulings that make it clear  many police stops in New York City violate Fourth Amendment; notes Scheindlin's decision to grant class-action status to lawsuit brought by public housing residents and visitors who say they were illegally stopped or arrested by police in their buildings; urges next mayor to bring police department policy in line with the Constitution instead of appealing these cases.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge made the right decision to grant class-action status to a lawsuit brought by public housing residents and their visitors.
